intro: Echium granatense, commonly known as the Granada thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves are adaptations to its arid and sunny habitat. Echium granatense is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
